posts.post_content:
Sometimes, you might want to return your own stuff to your hand...   
  
But you usually don't.   
  
This is also in the same playing field as playing a selfish landwipe: [Armageddon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armageddon) except it doesn't destroy your own lands (like if [Terra Eternal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Eternal) was out?) In fact, it's better!  
  
What if you have a 21/21 general without trample, and your opponent has [Glissa, the Traitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glissa, the Traitor)-like defenses (or some weak stuff with deathtouch)?   
  
Well, Cyclonic Rift, and you're golden. Byebye, opponent. And for the rest of you, I dare you to play all of those in one turn!
posts.html:
Sometimes, you might want to return your own stuff to your hand...

But you usually don't.

This is also in the same playing field as playing a selfish landwipe: Armageddon except it doesn't destroy your own lands (like if Terra Eternal was out?) In fact, it's better!

What if you have a 21/21 general without trample, and your opponent has Glissa, the Traitor-like defenses (or some weak stuff with deathtouch)?

Well, Cyclonic Rift, and you're golden. Byebye, opponent. And for the rest of you, I dare you to play all of those in one turn!

posts.post_content: Because it is a relatively narrow card (compared to [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon) in a creature-heavy format), this is a 2-of in my UR deck. [Goblin Electromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Electromancer) helps its cost out a lot. However I may end up going 4-of (instead of two Unsummon) because whenever I cast this, it makes a massive impact on the game and I end up winning. Overload is auto-win if cast at the end of opponents turn. Works very well in conjunction with counterspells (Ban Cavern, WotC! Can't stand another year of it!). 4.5/5
posts.html:
Because it is a relatively narrow card (compared to Unsummon in a creature-heavy format), this is a 2-of in my UR deck. Goblin Electromancer helps its cost out a lot. However I may end up going 4-of (instead of two Unsummon) because whenever I cast this, it makes a massive impact on the game and I end up winning.
